reviews.review:
[h1]This is a Review & Comparison between all CS versions![/h1]

CS 1.6 was ported to Valve's new engine, Source, back in 2004. Later it recieved a facelift when the Orange Box came out back in 2008 I believe, and countless contributions by the community followed, and "finished" the game.
The original CS could let you have lots of custom stuff, CSS also lets you do that, not like CS:GO.. *Sprays, skins, sounds, more..*
Also, I believe that CS 1.6 *CS:CZ is literally the same thing, but they are somewhat shared sometimes by AMXX* and CS:S are more moddeable than CS:GO.. For example, I saw a Quake 3 Arena style mod for CS 1.6, and the fabulous cooperative Trikz mod for CS:S..
Another thing, could be the superior movement. In CS 1.6, I don't need to speak the ammount of Bhop / KZ, etc maps it has.. and CS:S since it has increased limits by very far.. CS:GO has most badly ported maps from CS:S and the bhoping there isn't very good. For something, tons of players who bhopped/KZ'eed, moved to CS:S, for it's superior movement and fully properly made maps.
And for finishing, CS 1.6 is a good game, but remember that it has Steam AND Nosteam servers, which.. it can be a patience eater sometimes, and tons of servers have it's problems with the people and the lack of func_vehicle.
CS:GO... I don't need to talk about the community.. you need to dig a lot to find a server to stay pacifically
CS:S is the middle point between CS 1.6 and CSGO, most people have fun and there aren't that "much" problems, for something it costs more than CSGO..
Нашел что то среднее между си ес говноу и святой 1.6. Поставил бинд на колесо мыши для распрыжки. В итоге дали вак. Спасибо валв. А так игра 10 олдов из 10.
door stuck! haha1! like the meme. Laugh.
